abstract: A user interface that manages the printing of documents, images, and other printable content in iOS.
overview:
## Overview

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] is the central class for printing in iOS. The shared instance of it represents a print job. A print job includes the content to print and information and options related to its printing, such as output type, job name, paper size, and orientation.

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] has four mutually exclusive properties for giving it the content to print:

If the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/showsPageRange] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the number of pages is more than 1, and you assign an object to any of these properties except for the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printingItems] property, the printing options include a control that allows users to select a page range.

When users tap a print button on the app’s user interface, a controller object of the app should respond to the action message by obtaining the shared instance of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] and preparing it for the print job. When the app calls one of the `present...` methods (for example, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/present(animated:completionHandler:)]), [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] displays a view containing printing options. This interface is simple, allowing users to select a printer, specify the number of copies and possibly a range of pages, and choose single-sided or double-sided printing (if the printer supports duplex printing). When users make their selections and tap Print, the print job begins.

For design guidance, see [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/ios/system-capabilities/printing/].
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController
crawled: 2025-12-01T10:37:50Z
---

# UIPrintInteractionController

**Class**

A user interface that manages the printing of documents, images, and other printable content in iOS.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIPrintInteractionController
```

## Overview

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] is the central class for printing in iOS. The shared instance of it represents a print job. A print job includes the content to print and information and options related to its printing, such as output type, job name, paper size, and orientation.

[doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] has four mutually exclusive properties for giving it the content to print:

- [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printingItem] takes a single print-ready object.
- [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printingItems] takes an array of print-ready objects.
- [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printFormatter] takes a print formatter, an object that knows how to lay out content of a certain type.
- [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printPageRenderer] takes a page renderer, a custom object that draws the content for printing.

If the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/showsPageRange] property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], the number of pages is more than 1, and you assign an object to any of these properties except for the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/printingItems] property, the printing options include a control that allows users to select a page range.

When users tap a print button on the app’s user interface, a controller object of the app should respond to the action message by obtaining the shared instance of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] and preparing it for the print job. When the app calls one of the `present...` methods (for example, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController/present(animated:completionHandler:)]), [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintInteractionController] displays a view containing printing options. This interface is simple, allowing users to select a printer, specify the number of copies and possibly a range of pages, and choose single-sided or double-sided printing (if the printer supports duplex printing). When users make their selections and tap Print, the print job begins.

For design guidance, see [https://developer.apple.com/design/human-interface-guidelines/ios/system-capabilities/printing/].

## Getting the shared controller instance

- **shared**: The shared print-interaction controller object.

## Assigning the delegate

- **delegate**: The delegate of the print-interaction controller.
- **UIPrintInteractionControllerDelegate**: An optional set of methods that the delegate of the shared print-interaction controller implements.

## Determining printability

- **isPrintingAvailable**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the device supports printing.
- **canPrint(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether UIKit can print the contents of a data object.
- **canPrint(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether UIKit can print the file that the specified URL references.
- **printableUTIs**: Returns a set of the Uniform Type Identifiers for the types of data that UIKit can print.

## Providing the source of printable content

- **printingItem**: A single ready-to-print object.
- **printingItems**: An array of ready-to-print objects.
- **printPageRenderer**: An object that draws pages of printable content when UIKit requests it.
- **printFormatter**: An object that lays out the content of pages according to the kind of content.

## Presenting the printing user interface

- **present(animated:completionHandler:)**: Presents the iPhone printing user interface in a sheet, optionally animating it to slide up from the bottom of the screen.
- **present(from:animated:completionHandler:)**: Presents the iPad printing user interface in a popover view, optionally animating it from a bar-button item.
- **present(from:in:animated:completionHandler:)**: Presents the iPad printing user interface in a popover view, optionally animating it from any area in a view.
- **dismiss(animated:)**: Dismisses the printing-options sheet or popover.

## Printing directly to a printer

- **print(to:completionHandler:)**: Prints directly to the specified printer.
- **UIPrintInteractionController.CompletionHandler**: A completion handler for responding to the completion of a print job or for handling printing errors.

## Accessing print-job information

- **printInfo**: An object that encapsulates information about the print job.
- **printPaper**: An object that represents the paper size and printing area for the print job.
- **showsNumberOfCopies**: A Boolean value that determines whether the printing options include the number of copies.
- **showsPaperSelectionForLoadedPapers**: A Boolean value that determines whether the paper selection menu displays.
- **showsPaperOrientation**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the printing options include the paper-orientation control.
- **showsPageRange**: A Boolean value that determines whether the printing options include a page-range control.

## Handling printing errors

- **UIPrintErrorDomain**: The string constant that defines the UIKit printing error domain.
- **UIPrintError**: A structure that contains information about a printing error.
- **UIPrintError.Code**: Constants that specify the print error code.

## Print panels

- **UIPrinterPickerController**: A view controller that displays the standard interface for selecting a printer.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
